author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Bengaluru police have arrested two people, including the owner of the building and sub-contractor, in connection with the death of 23-year-old Mounika Reddy on the J.P. Nagar premises of Infosys on Tuesday. She was on the phone with her family when a few concrete hollow bricks fell on her.

The arrested have been identified as Mohan Raj, owner of the building, and Nanjunda, sub-contractor. The duo were produced before the court on Wednesday and remanded in judicial custody. Police sources said efforts were on to nab two others — Shankar, a fabricator, and Nagaraj, site supervisor.

Mounika, a B.Sc. graduate, had come from Chittoor, Andhra Pradesh, to Bengaluru for an interview at Infosys. Meanwhile, Mounika’s parents reached Bengaluru on Wednesday to claim the body.
title: Two arrested in IT job aspirant death case
